comments:
Eclipse 200405060200   CDT 200405052036

If there is a compiling error in a subdirectory (or deeper level) in a 
project, no error markers will show in the editor.  

In the problems view, the "In Folder" column will be empty.

The Error markers will show only for source files at the project level.

Got this exception:

Raised to P1 for visibility.

This is very annoying.   No error markers will be shown beyond the project 
level source files.  Any error in subdirectories will not show up.

However, I can't reproduce the exception.  I think it is unrelated to this 
problem.

This is a must-fix.

Please give a test case, or how to reproduce this.
Is this a managed builder project ?

Thanks.

The test was done with a Managed Project (I haven't tested standard make)

Steps:
1) Create a Managed Project called MgdCpp
2) Import the BubbleSort file system (attached) into MgdCpp
3) Go into MgdCpp/BubbleSort/B0/SD_01.cpp and remove a semi-colon to create a 
compiling error.
4) Build.

The error will show in the Problems view but it does not go to the location of 
the compiling error after you double-click on it because no error markers are 
showing.
The error markers are only showing in the MgdCpp level and not below (like in 
the BubbleSort, BO directories).

The managed Builder does not tell the error parser where
the build is started.  By default the error parser manager assumes
the project location unless specify otherwise 
But the build is actually started in
MgdCpp/Debug

so when we look for the file "../B0/SD_01.cpp" it resolves to
new Path("MgdCPP/../B0/SD_01.cpp");
obviously not what you want.

Reassigning to the correct component.

Sean:  When you call the ErrorParserManager provide the correct
       working directory.
